raw_response: {"answer_index": 3, "answer_text": "Extracellular space", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has signs of scurvy (vitamin C deficiency): fatigue, gum bleeding/swelling, petechiae, low BMI (malnutrition), and hemarthrosis. Vitamin C is required for the hydroxylation of proline and lysine residues during collagen synthesis, which occurs in the rough ER, but the final cross-linking of collagen fibers (which is defective in scurvy) occurs in the extracellular space. The bleeding and poor wound healing are due to defective collagen in the extracellular matrix.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
